episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on the Rise and Fall of Fergie and Why Andrew Might End Up in Jail
episodes.description:
Andrew Lownie returns to 'Throwing the Book at Them' for his third in-depth interview about 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York'.

Andrew gives us an exclusive new revelation and we spoke about everything that's happened since the book came out three months ago and then focused on Sarah Ferguson's stratospheric rise and fall and how her childhood might hold the key to her behaviour. 

00:00:00 Where the story stands now after the latest leaks
00:02:00 How the August interview set the stage; what changed since
00:04:00 The US leak pipeline and why timing matters
00:06:00 National-security angles around Andrew’s networks
00:08:00 Why Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Libya, China, and Ukraine recur
00:10:00 Mandelson–Epstein–Andrew overlap; Clinton questions
00:12:00 How “insurance files” and selective disclosure shape narratives
00:14:00 What the new material actually proves vs. suggests
00:16:00 Andrew’s commercial diplomacy pattern and opaque deals
00:18:00 What would be required to trigger formal legal action
00:20:00 The Royal Lodge moment and titles as narrative turning point
00:22:00 Fergie’s crisis strategy: distance, rebrand, survive
00:24:00 Alleged attempts to discredit Virginia Giuffre and PR lawfare
00:26:00 Why certain tabloids remain sympathetic; access journalism
00:28:00 Early-life aristocratic emotional imprint and abandonment themes
00:30:00 Courtship to marriage: intensity, narcissism, unraveling
00:32:00 Arrested development and refusal to mature
00:34:00 Money habits as identity, validation, and emotional coping
00:36:00 Reports of aggressive arguments and volatile episodes
00:38:00 Staff testimony: rudeness, protocol fixation, late-night demands
00:40:00 Freebies, foreign trips, “Knockout,” and slide into vulgarity
00:42:00 The £860k lifestyle economy: gifts, travel, wardrobes
00:44:00 Hoarding, excess buying, generosity as approval mechanism
00:46:00 Charity optics vs. actual outcomes
00:48:00 Parenting reality vs. public image
00:50:00 Sunninghill atmosphere, exclusion, and silent family distances
00:52:00 Gate-racing temper, smashed plates, Windsor anger patterns
00:54:00 Everything transactional: tickets, invites, introductions
00:56:00 Diana & Fergie: rivalry, leaks, reconciliation, fracture
00:58:00 Reputation management after 1997
01:00:00 Fergie & Epstein: logs, contact timeline, contradictions
01:02:00 The 2011 letter vs. later condemnations
01:04:00 Media choreography around interviews and PR containment
01:06:00 What Andrew and Fergie do now: private deals
01:08:00 What more could emerge
01:10:00 Political collateral: who remains protected and why
01:12:00 Titles as cash-flow: Beatrice and Eugenie’s branding value
01:14:00 Press relationships and how coverage is managed
01:16:00 Pattern of institutional containment until scandal breaks
01:18:00 What a real reckoning would require and what could move the needle next

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on how the Palace Cover-up Prolonged the Abuse
episodes.description:
Andrew Lownie discusses the palace cover-up, how Andrew met Epstein and what he's found out since the release of his revelatory book 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York'.

00:00:00 – Reaction to Andrew Lownie’s book & new stories since publication
00:01:04 – Senior insiders now willing to go on the record
00:02:03 – Calls for inquiry into Andrew’s finances and role as Special Representative
00:02:49 – Could more extreme Epstein material still be released?
00:03:12 – Witnesses, Tiffany Doe & Virginia Giuffre’s testimony
00:03:56 – Epstein, Andrew & Kazakhstan tales
00:04:12 – How Andrew & Epstein first met – Late 1990s or earlier?
00:05:23 – Fergie’s introduction & the disputed timeline
00:06:17 – Sarah Ferguson’s friendship with Epstein 
00:07:30 – Girlfriends of Andrew linked to Epstein and Trump
00:08:17 – Scale of witness testimony beyond Virginia Giuffre
00:09:52 – BBC Panorama, Amy Robach & the palace blocking media stories
00:12:18 – Did the palace prolong abuse by covering up Epstein links?
00:13:26 – Was Andrew blackmailed? Epstein, kompromat & intelligence services
00:14:43 – Palace complaints ignored; Queen’s blind spot for Andrew
00:17:07 – Andrew’s close ties with Donald Trump
00:18:19 – Massage tables, escorts & sex workers on official trips
00:19:57 – Jean-Luc Brunel, trafficking, and French police interest in Andrew
00:21:26 – The real story behind Panorama vs Newsnight
00:23:41 – Laura Burns’ role erased from history
00:24:17 – The Robert Maxwell connection? 
00:26:27 – Epstein’s state backing, Saudi passport & Mossad links
00:28:32 – Was Andrew naive or a willing traitor?
00:31:18 – John Mark Dougan & the missing Epstein tapes in Russia
00:33:10 – Financial ties between Andrew & Ghislaine Maxwell
00:34:08 – Trump as supposed FBI informant? Andrew Lownie’s verdict
00:35:36 – Epstein’s “scientific” respectability & Andrew’s supposed curiosity
00:38:21 – What surprised Andrew Lownie most in his research
00:39:20 – Epstein’s “photo books” & Andrew ordering girls from a catalogue
00:40:39 – Why did the Met Police refuse to investigate Andrew?
00:42:29 – Charles lending money for Andrew’s Giuffre settlement
00:44:11 – Charles’ Balmoral “crisis summit” and PR damage control
00:46:14 – William’s likely ruthlessness vs Andrew in future
00:46:53 – Parallels with Mountbatten scandal cover-up
00:48:45 – Fifth Amendment: why so many refused to answer about Andrew
00:50:54 – NDAs, bugging staff, and Andrew’s inappropriate behaviour

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on Prince Andrew and the Queen's Moral Abdication
episodes.description:
I talked to Andrew Lownie about 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York'. We covered Prince Andrew and Epstein, how the Queen knew there were concerns about his behaviour, and the stuff that he couldn't put in the book.

00:00:00 – Jacob Rees-Mogg interview aftermath 
00:02:00 – Royal scandals historically suppressed
00:05:00 – Lownie’s path from intelligence to royal books
00:10:00 – NDAs, spies & nervous sources in Kazakhstan
00:12:00 – Prince Andrew’s childhood: spoiled, entitled, no boundaries
00:15:00 – Fergie’s debts, Epstein’s role & the divine right of kings
00:19:00 – Rage and bullying: Windsor family tradition
00:20:00 – Queen refused to protect Andrew early, then compensated victims
00:22:00 – The Queen knew exactly what was going on
00:25:00 – MI5 “dry-cleaned” Fergie’s past
00:27:00 – Moral abdication: why the Queen shielded Andrew
00:29:00 – Institutional dishonesty in the monarchy
00:30:00 – Andrew admits: “We’ve been lying to the press for 20 years”
00:31:00 – Charles’s scandals and Middle Eastern money
00:34:00 – Offshore trusts, Sunninghill and suspicious deals
00:36:00 – David Rowland: Andrew’s key fixer
00:41:42 - The Peter Mandelson Connection
00:46:00 – Gifts, jewellery and Selman Turk’s £750k transfers
00:47:00 – “He’s just a useful idiot”
00:48:00 – Could Andrew be the perfect money-laundering front?
00:49:00 – Why no inquiry will ever happen
00:52:00 – Fergie stayed in Epstein’s flat until 2014
00:54:00 – Doormen in full dress uniform when Fergie visited
00:55:00 – Patronage-for-MBA corruption story
00:58:00 – Charles vs Andrew: Royal Lodge siege
01:00:00 – The Press Reaction to the Book
01:01:00 – Murdoch, King Charles, Sarah Ferguson and the Max Clifford school of PR
